scene_description_enriched: The scene depicts a macabre feast, likely the Beheading of Saint John the Baptist. In the foreground, a woman in a green gown stands beside a table draped with a white cloth, on which rests a platter with the severed head of a man with a halo, suggesting sainthood. Another woman in blue, adorned with a crown, appears to be presenting the head. To the left, a man in blue attire holds a sword and a basket, possibly having just carried out the execution. Behind them, a group of figures in various colored attire and hats are gathered, some holding cups. In the background, a man plays a lute, and another plays a pipe, adding a festive, albeit unsettling, element to the scene. Beyond this, a wooden fence encloses a grassy area, and in the far distance, a landscape with mountains and two winged figures (possibly angels) is visible through a window.
scene_interpretation: Beheading of Saint John the Baptist
